text: <@U0NK7T8SH>: Sorry I/we have missed your question earlier.
You can simply update the certificate that is being loaded/used.
Noting that the one that is “shipped” or temporarily generated in `v0.6` was intended at first just to “get you going”…
It is being loaded from the `/var` folder… so just quickly (this also applies/relevant/related to <@U16A62N2D> ’s question above): are you able to restart the `memberservc` service?)

<@U327VGGF9> They are not compatible at a plug-and-play component level.  COP speaks REST and membersrvc speaks GRPC.  The configuration elements have also changed.  The way in which compatibility is sort-of preserved is that if you were using the node SDK for example in v06 which knows how to speak to membersrvc, then using the node SDK (or java SDK) in v1 will know how to talk to COP

____
<@U327VGGF9> There are already a few considerable changes in the `master` branch that may affect you.
That said, the SDK work is a work in progress to speak to COP

Yes (oh, Keith and I were typing at the same time). I was about to ask something similarly: it depends on what you need to be “compatible”…  is it in the “application” layer, that is, sitting “on top of the SDK”…. or do you care more about re-using certs, etc?
Yes, way too early (and it’s way too cold for me here ;-))
Yes, we were at the Hyperledger Hackfest, followed by the Members Summit.
I will be back online later though.
<https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/2817>    *Abstract DB and enable plugging in LDAP*   is merged.
<@U11MANG9G>  <@U0S5KF44D>  Thank you for you kindly reply.

<@U11MANG9G>  I  imagined that maybe membersrvc could be updated from v0.6 to v1.0 separately so that I could update the hyperledger one module by one module smoothly .   But now it seems that a lot of things have to be prepared and should be complete in one time if updating from v0.6 to v1.0, including COP, fabric, SDK  and  configurations files etc.
